documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
ABOUT US Privacy Policy Tools
  • Add to my Library
  • Email
  • Share How would you like to share? Facebook Twitter LinkedIn
  • Print
Back to the Top

The Alzforum website (the “Site”) collects information in order to serve you better--by providing better information and creating a valuable community in which to discuss ideas, issues and share data and expertise with other members. Any personal information we collect will be used solely to improve our services, and will not be sold to other companies without your consent. This privacy policy governs personal information collected by us on the Site as well as through any digital products and services or mobile applications that we may offer from time to time with respect to Alzforum.

What information we gather and how we gather it
How we use and disclose your information
Opt-in/Opt-out
Reviewing or changing your information/Profile Page
Improper Conduct
Protection for Children
Your Consent
Contacting Us

1. What Information We Gather and How We Gather It

Membership Application and Online Registration. To process your Alzforum membership and/or your online registration, we may ask you to provide common required information including name, email address, etc.

Automatically Collected Information. We collect data about the movement of users on the Site. This may include the Internet Protocol Address of your computer, host name, domain name, browser version and platform, date and time of requests and files downloaded or viewed. We use this information to analyze usage of the Site. We also use cookies to collect information and personalize your experience on the Site. We store a limited amount of personal information in cookies.

2. How We Use and Disclose Your Information

We do not sell your personally identifiable information to third parties or mass marketers. For example, we will not sell another company your name or email address. On occasions, we may ask for your consent to share particular data with a third party. In addition, we reserve the right, without disclosing your personally identifiable information to third parties, to use the information you provide to offer you additional Alzforum or third party products and services that we think will be of interest to you.

We do disclose aggregated data to our sponsors and co-branded partners to generate reports and marketing research. For example, we tell funding agencies how many people visit the Site or specific parts of the Site. Where available, we may offer additional information about viewer characteristics. However this does not include personally identifiable information about you or your online usage patterns.

If you choose to receive the free Alzforum Newsletter as set forth below (see “Opt-in/Opt-out”), we will use these newsletters to provide you with news, events, special offers, site upgrades and much more.

On occasion, we may use the content you post in the Site’s community section including chat rooms and discussions or any other public section of the Site for promotional purposes, in email newsletters, in promotional collateral, or elsewhere and by using the Site you agree that we may do so. You should exercise caution when deciding to disclose your personal information in these areas.

We may share your personally identifiable information with third parties with which we contract to help enhance the functionality of the Site and provide new products, services and content. For example, we use third parties for webinar registration and for newsletter generation. We make sure that these third parties do not use this information for any other purpose and do not share the information with any other third party. These third parties must maintain the confidentiality of your personal information and have access to your personal information only to the extent necessary to perform the function that we have requested.

3. Security Measures

We take measures to secure the personal information that users submit on the Site. We encrypt such information using Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology.

4. Opt-in/Opt-out

You have the option to sign up for the free Alzforum Newsletter by submitting your email address via the Newsletter sign-up page on the Site or by checking the box on your Site profile page.

To opt out from receiving these emails, you can click on the link located at the bottom of the email newsletter or change your profile on the Site.

We are not responsible for removing information from third-party lists or databases.

5. Reviewing or Changing Your Information

In order to ensure that the information we maintain is accurate, the Site gives users the option to change or modify their previously provided information. Users can manage their profile in the MyXForum area of the Site. Site editors have access to the users’ profile changes. Users can submit corrections to comments that they previously posted on the Site.

6. Improper Conduct

The restrictions above will not apply in the event that you engage in certain improper conduct. Specifically, we shall have the right ourselves to use or release to third parties personally identifiable information regarding users who are suspected of having used the Site for any fraudulent purposes or having otherwise violated any law rule or regulation.

7. Protection for Children

We have no intention of collecting personally identifiable information from children (i.e., individuals under the age of 13).  If a child has provided us with individually identifiable information, that child's parent or guardian should Contact Us to have this information deleted from our records.

8. Your Consent

By using the Site, you consent to the collection and use of information by Alzforum in the manner explained above. If we decide to change this Privacy Policy, we will post the revised Privacy Policy on the Site so you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances we disclose it. Use of the Site constitutes consent to the Privacy Policy then in effect.

9. Contacting Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, the practices of the Site, or your dealings with the Site, please Contact Us.

NEXT: Copyright

documents.name: Terms of Use
documents.text:
ABOUT US Terms of Use Tools
  • Add to my Library
  • Email
  • Share How would you like to share? Facebook Twitter LinkedIn
  • Print
Back to the Top

1. General

These Terms of Use (“Terms”) were last modified on 4 April 2018.

These Terms are a binding agreement between you and FBRI LLC (“FBRI”). By using or accessing the Alzforum website (the “Site”), you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms. Your use of the Site is governed by the version of the Terms in effect on the date the Site is accessed by you. FBRI may modify these Terms at any time and without prior notice.

Unless otherwise agreed, FBRI may discontinue or modify the Site at any time without prior notice to you, and you accept those modifications if you continue to use the Site.

This Site is intended only for your personal, non-commercial use, unless you and FBRI have agreed otherwise in writing.

These Terms govern your use of the Site as well as any digital products and services or mobile applications that FBRI may offer from time to time with respect to Alzforum.

2. Content

2.1. Ownership of Content
All text, graphics and other materials on the Site ("Content") are the property of FBRI, or its licensors, suppliers and other third parties mentioned on the Site (collectively the "Third Party Content Providers"), in each case as indicated by the copyright notice for each Content item. All works of authorship are protected by applicable copyright laws. All trademarks and service marks on the Site belong to FBRI or its parent FMR LLC (“FMR”), except third party trademarks and service marks, which are the property of their respective owners.

The Site includes news and information, tools, commentary, research reports and data concerning Alzheimer’s disease and other subjects. Some content is supplied by FBRI, some (the “Third Party Content”) is provided by Third Party Content Providers and some is provided by users of the Site (see “User-Generated Content” below).

2.2. User-Generated Content
If you submit any information, idea, concept or invention to the Site you agree that FBRI may release such submission to others, subject to the Alzforum Privacy Policy, and you automatically grant or warrant that the owner of such content or intellectual property has expressly granted FBRI a royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, world-wide nonexclusive license to store, use, reproduce, create derivative works from, modify, publish, edit, translate, distribute, perform, and display such intellectual property in any media or medium, or any form, format, or forum now known or hereafter developed. FBRI may sublicense its rights through multiple tiers of sublicenses.

You warrant that your submissions are truthful and provided in good faith. you understand that users are relying on the accuracy and truthfulness of submissions made, and that FBRI, and the scientific community in general, can be damaged if any of your submissions are false or misleading.

You authorize FBRI to publish your name, affiliation and/or geographic location in connection with your submission. Once your submission is posted, you acknowledge that you will not have the right to remove or edit it.

FBRI reserves the right, but is not obligated, to do any or all of the following:

1. Record the dialogue in online forums.
2. Investigate an allegation that a communication(s) do(es) not conform to the terms of this section and determine in its sole discretion to remove or request the removal of the communication(s).
3. Edit or remove communications which fail to conform with these Terms.
4. Terminate a user's access to any or all interactive areas of the Site (or otherwise revoke a user’s privilege to submit content) for any reason, without prior notice.
5. Monitor, edit, or disclose any submission you make to the Site, subject to the Alzforum Privacy Policy.
6. Edit or delete any communication(s) posted on the Site, regardless of whether such communication(s) violates these Terms.

FBRI reserves the right to edit comments and other text submissions posted to or otherwise submitted to the Site, and also reserves the right not to post or to terminate the posting of comments or other text submissions.

FBRI and the Third Party Content providers have no liability or responsibility to users of the Site or any other person or entity for performance or non-performance of the aforementioned activities.

FBRI shall have no liability to protect, store or maintain the annotations that users of the Site may add to the Content on the Site.

2.3. Third Party Content
Although Third Party Content may be displayed on the Site or available through a link to a third-party site, FBRI has not been involved in the preparation, adoption or editing of Third Party Content. While FBRI makes every attempt to provide accurate and timely information to serve the needs of users, neither FBRI nor the Third Party Content Providers guarantee its accuracy, timeliness, completeness or usefulness, and are not responsible or liable for any such content, including any advertising, products, or other materials on or available from third party sites. FBRI and the Third Party Content Providers specifically disclaim any responsibility for Content available on the Site. The use of the Site and the Content, including Third Party Content, is at your own risk.

3. Use of Site

3.1. Use of the Site
If you use the Site you are solely responsible for your own communications, the consequences of posting those communications, and your reliance on any communications found on the Site. FBRI and the Third Party Content providers are not responsible for the consequences of any communications provided by you or other third parties on the Site.

3.2. Account and Password
The Site has several tools that allow you to record and store information and require a login. You may not obtain or attempt to obtain unauthorized access to such areas of the Site through any means not intentionally made available by FBRI for your specific use. You are responsible for all activities that occur in connection with your account and password. It is your sole responsibility to (1) control the dissemination and use of activation codes and passwords. (2) restrict access to and use of your Alzforum account and password. (3) promptly inform FBRI of any need to deactivate a password. and (4) notify FBRI immediately if you become aware of any disclosure, loss, theft or unauthorized use of your password.

3.3. Prohibited Uses
FBRI reserves the right to limit a user’s access to the Site if a user is deemed to violate any of the conditions stated in this Terms of Use.

You shall not

(1) use the Site for any illegal purpose
(2) distribute any viruses or other harmful computer code to any FBRI server, or any network connected to any FBRI server
(3) use the Site in any manner that could damage or overburden any FBRI server, or any network connected to any FBRI server
(4) access the Site through devices or services that are designed to provide high-speed, automated, repeated access, unless such devices are approved or made available by FBRI
(5) engage in any other conduct that restricts or inhibits, any other person from using or enjoying the Site, or,
(6) engage in any other conduct which, in the judgment of FBRI, exposes FBRI or any of its site users or content providers to any liability or detriment of any type.

You may not copy, distribute, modify, post or frame-in the Site, including any text, graphics, video, audio, software code, user interface design or logos, without prior written permission from FBRI or the copyright owner. You may not alter or remove any trademark, copyright or other notice from the Content.

If you make submissions to the Site, you agree that you will not (1) send or transmit to the Site any communications, content or submissions of any kind that infringe or violate the intellectual property, privacy, publicity or other rights of any party or that are unlawful, obscene, defamatory, threatening, harassing, abusive, slanderous, hateful, or embarrassing to any other person or entity as determined by FBRI in its sole discretion, or (2) post personal information of any other person (including, without limitation, Protected Health Information).

3.4. Linking Policy
Unless you and FBRI have agreed otherwise, links from another website to the Site must resolve to the top-level homepage of the Site. If you place a link on your or another web site to the Site, neither the web site nor the link may suggest that FBRI or Alzforum endorses, sponsors or is affiliated with any other site, entity, service or product, and you may not make use of any trademarks or service marks of FBRI or FMR other than those contained within the text of the link.

4. Disclaimer of Medical Advice

The Site does not provide medical advice. The Content is for informational, educational, research and reference purposes only and is not intended to substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis or treatment. Always seek advice from a qualified physician or health care professional about any medical concern, and do not disregard professional medical advice because of anything you may read on the Site. The views of individuals quoted on this Site are not necessarily those of FBRI.

Neither the Site nor FBRI endorses any company or product, and listing on the Site is not linked to corporate sponsorship nor does it imply any endorsement by the Site or FBRI. We do not make a claim to being comprehensive or up-to-date.

5. Disclaimer of Warranties

THE SITE AND ITS CONTENT IS PROVIDED ON AN "AS-IS" BASIS. FBRI AND THE THIRD PARTY CONTENT PROVIDERS EXPRESSLY DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION ANY WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, FUNCTIONALITY OR NON-INFRINGEMENT. FBRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE SITE OR ITS CONTENT WILL MEET YOUR NEEDS OR THAT EITHER WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, TIMELY, SECURE OR ERROR-FREE. FBRI ALSO MAKES NO WARRANTY THAT THE RESULTS OBTAINED FROM THE USE OF THE SITE AND ITS CONTENT WILL BE ACCURATE OR RELIABLE, OR THAT THE QUALITY OF ANY PRODUCTS, SERVICES, INFORMATION, OR OTHER MATERIAL OBTAINED BY YOU THROUGH THE SITE WILL MEET YOUR EXPECTATIONS. FBRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE SITE WILL APPEAR ACCURATELY THROUGH ALL WEB BROWSERS AND ACCESS METHODS.

6. Limitation of Liability

IN NO EVENT WILL FBRI OR THE THIRD PARTY CONTENT PROVIDERS, AND RESPECTIVELY THEIR PARENTS, SUBSIDIARIES, AFFILIATES, SERVICE PROVIDERS, LICENSORS, OFFICERS, DIRECTORS OR EMPLOYEES, BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, DIRECT, OR INDIRECT DAMAGES (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO LOST PROFITS, TRADING LOSSES OR DAMAGES THAT RESULT FROM USE OR LOSS OF USE OF THE SITE OR THIRD PARTY CONTENT, INCONVENIENCE OR DELAY). THIS IS TRUE EVEN IF FBRI OR THE THIRD PARTY CONTENT PROVIDER HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES OR LOSSES. FBRI AND THE THIRD PARTY CONTENT PROVIDERS ARE NOT LIABLE FOR ANY PERSONAL INJURY INCLUDING DEATH. FBRI AND THE THIRD PARTY CONTENT PROVIDERS WILL NOT BE LIABLE TO YOU OR ANYONE ELSE FOR ANY LOSS RESULTING FROM A CAUSE OVER WHICH SUCH PARTY DOES NOT HAVE DIRECT CONTROL. IF YOU LIVE IN A STATE THAT DOES NOT ALLOW THE LIMITATION OR EXCLUSION OF LIABILITY OR INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, SOME OR ALL OF THESE LIMITATIONS AND EXCLUSIONS MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU.

7. Indemnification

As a condition of your use of the Site, you agree to indemnify and hold FBRI harmless from and against any and all claims, losses, liability, costs and expenses (including but not limited to attorneys' fees) arising from your use of the Site, from your violation of these Terms, or from your violation of any law or the rights of a third party.

8. Jurisdiction

Unless otherwise agreed, these terms and their enforcement are governed by the laws of the United States of America and the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, without regard to conflicts of law, and shall inure to the benefit of FBRI's successors and assigns, whether by merger, consolidation, or otherwise.

9. Severability

If a court of competent jurisdiction deems any provision unenforceable, that provision will be enforced to the maximum extent permissible, and the remaining provisions will remain in full force and effect. Exclusive jurisdiction for any claim or cause of action relating to the Site shall be with the state or federal courts located in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. The Site is controlled and operated from the United States of America. If you access the Site from outside the United States, you are responsible for compliance with all applicable laws, rules and regulations.

10. Complete Agreement

Except as expressly provided in another legal notice on the Site, these Terms of Use constitute the entire agreement between you and FBRI with respect to the use of the Site.

NEXT: Privacy Policy
